text: Thesis Supervisor: Prof. Jayant K Singh Department of Chemical Engineering IIT Kanpur (March’24-Present)
bullets: To develop a soil health detection device that involves integration of spectroscopy principles and sensor technology to accurately analyze the soil micronutrients, combined with ML approach to enhance precision and reliability in nutrient analysis

Collected LEDs and soil elements concentration data and applied RF, SVM, XGBoost etc. to predict the concentration of the soil nutrients and improve precision, performance, ensuring accurate predictions when compared with the experimental data
Attained the R 2 scores of 0.7 - 0.9 for various nutrients using the ensemble machine learning techniques

The motivation behind this project is to empower Indian farmers by offering a non-destructive approach to the soil analysis, ultimately contributing to India's journey toward self-reliance and fostering the sustainable agricultural prosperity

text: Mentor: Prof. Jayant K Singh Department of Chemical Engineering IIT Kanpur (Dec’23-Feb’24 )
bullets: Performed experiments for synthesizing MXene from the MAX Phase( Mo2Ga2C) by etching technique
The surface morphology of the synthesized MXene was thoroughly examined using scanning electron microscopy(SEM)
